attributes.action: Review childcare allowances for working parents.
attributes.additional_details:
More needs to be done to help working parents with childcare. It’s almost impossible for a mother to go back to full time work after maternity as childcare costs usually outweigh wages forcing more mothers to claim benefits. With the rising cost of living this is not sustainable if the government expects those on regular wages to be able to afford to live. 

Sources:

https://www.familyandchildcaretrust.org/file/4010/download?token=PIAGXSOP 

https://www.gov.uk/help-with-childcare-costs
attributes.background: The government needs to review the current allowances for working parents. Most working couples get no help before their children are three, whereas those who are not at work get allowances from two years old and they also receive more hours when their children turn three.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about the current level of support for working parents, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
